newsitem.title: USA: Equity Oil adds 1.51 mln BOEs in reserves.
newsitem.headline: Equity Oil adds 1.51 mln BOEs in reserves.

text.p: Equity Oil Co said on Wednesday it added 1.51 million barrels of oil equivalent to its proved reserve base, as a result of 1996 drilling and acquisition activities in the United States and Canada.
This resulted in a net five percent gain in its reserves, replacing 158 percent of 1996 oil and gas production, the company said.
The company also said it expected 1997 to be a year of "measurable growth and progress."

At year end 1996, proved reserves stood at 8.37 million barrels of oil and 17.6 billion feet of natural gas, the company said. The pre-tax net present value of the reserves at the end of the year totaled $79 million, 85 percent than 1995's year end value of $43 million, it said.

"The reserve and production increases are a direct consequence of the growth strategy we announced in 1995 balancing our exploration, development and acquisition activities," Paul Dougan, president and chief executive officer, said.
He said the increase in the year-end value of the reserves was due to very strong oil and gas prices in effect at December 31.
